bug.author: aamster
bug.summary: early stopping callback on_epoch_end called twice
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h4>What is your question?</denchmark-h>
I am confused on the early stopping behavior. The method seems to get called 2 times after a single validation epoch. It is called first from here <denchmark-link:https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/pytorch-lightning/blob/v0.7.5.x/pytorch_lightning/trainer/training_loop.py#L453>https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/pytorch-lightning/blob/v0.7.5.x/pytorch_lightning/trainer/training_loop.py#L453</denchmark-link> and next from here <denchmark-link:https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/pytorch-lightning/blob/v0.7.5.x/pytorch_lightning/trainer/training_loop.py#L363>https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/pytorch-lightning/blob/v0.7.5.x/pytorch_lightning/trainer/training_loop.py#L363</denchmark-link> . This results in in getting called I believe incorrectly. I.e what is happening is the current metric is checked, then it is checked immediately again and since it has not changed self.wait is incremented. <denchmark-h:h4>Code</denchmark-h>
I am passing this into the trainer <denchmark-code>early_stop_callback = EarlyStopping( monitor='validation_mean_precision', min_delta=0.00, patience=3, verbose=True, mode='max' ) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h4>What's your environment?</denchmark-h>
Packaging [conda] Version [0.7.6]

comments.comment: Hi! thanks for your contribution!, great first issue!

That is an issue in 0.7.6. There are multiple issues with this issue as well and it should be fixed in the next release. As a workaround for 0.7.6 you can double the number of patience to get the expected behavior.

Yes, I noticed the same issue. I tried modifying the EarlyStopping logic by replacing the on_epoch_end() hook with on_validation_end(), but it is never called inside the training loop. I think there should be a validation_epoch_end() hook like in LightningModule.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Borda>@Borda</denchmark-link> early stopping seems to work correctly in 0.8.0rc2. But in my mind this is a major bug in 0.7.6
well as v0.8.0 will be released shortly, we will not prepare any further fixes in v0.7.x but if you want and send a fix PR we can arrange it for you in v0.7.6.x branch üê∞
